text:
Dark brown to black colored, ruby hue, small tan head, only a ring. Aroma is malt, some chocolate and bit roasted malt, lots of dark fruit and some spicy Belgian yeast. Taste is medium sweet malt, brown sugar, bit caramel, milky chocolate, some roasted malt, very light smoke, some dark fruit, medium dark choco bitterness, some spicy Belgian yeast, dryish finish. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, creamy. Belgian yeast in stout is a turnoff usually but this one is quite nice!
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

Fad: Kulsort øl med e t flot skumhoved. Duften er maltet med en smule røg.Meget diskret røg. Smagen er rigtig lækker med en god del sødme fra malten. Mangler lige en tand humle for at bakke sødmen op. Røgen er fint med.
Una gran cerveza quizás uno de los pocos fallos que se la encuentra es la ligereza de su cuerpo
12 oz bottle from Liberty Beer in Pittsburgh. A bit heavy at times but never bitter or sour. Super in every way.

De color negro con espuma ocre densa e intensa. De aroma suave pero permanente. No es la tipica stout con sabores cafeteros sinomas bien dulces con un leve picor en lengua muy agradable de cuerpo no pesafo q hace que sea muy agradable en boca a pesar del grado alcoholico. Se disfruta mucho no fria . Me parece muy interesante y agradable. Para repetir. Interesante cerveceros.

Presenta negro intenso opaco con buena cabeza de espuma beige de larga retención, aromas a chocolate negro, grosellas, cerezas, ligero ahumado, café y malta tostada, en boca entrada media, maltosa, intensa con ligero amargor, cuerpo medio pleno y correcta carbonatación, siguen notas a licor y frutos negros; alcohol bien integrado en una equilibrada, compleja y excelente cerveza.

Color negro con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (no mucha retención). Carbonatación mínima. Textura oleosa. Aroma torrefacto, dulzón, con presencia de azúcar, vainilla, chocolate, licor, un mínimo toque ahumado... Sabor más dulce que amargo pero sin excesos. Mucho chocolate, vainilla, azúcar, ¿algún fruto seco?, y licor (alcohol no demasiado presente pero discernible). En boca queda algo de alcohol, vainilla y frutos secos entre trago y trago. Muy rica. Echo en falta algo de cremosidad.
From Miguel. In Teku glass. Removing beer labels. Just the adequate amount of licorice and pleasant herbal bitterness. Some chocolate, roasted without unpleasant torrefact notes
Soberbia Stout! Azúcar moreno, chocolate, algo de regaliz. Sabrosa. Bottled 2015/11. BB 2017/12

I enjoyed a snifter full of Stillwater Folklore alongside a steak in an effort to feel richer and classier than I actually am. That effort ultimately failed as I am, in fact, poor and classless, but it was a lovely pairing. Folklore pours opaque, inky black. Roasted malt, coffee, and cream aromatics. Flavors of licorice, cinnamon, vanilla, cocoa, tobacco, and coffee. Its been a while since Ive had a Foreign Stout. Its been even longer since I had one that was as tasty and complex as this beer. Even by Stillwaters high standards, this is exceptional.
Excellent brew likewise example of foreign stout. Great appearance with a long lasting head and lots of lace. Slightly sweet bitter plenty roasty. Rich body. Faultless finish.

Bouteille. Robe noire opaque avec un mince col de mousse brun pâle et laiteux. Arômes de baies confites, mélasse, malt rôti et café au lait et cacao. Également quelques notes de nougat, datte et caramel salé. En bouche, chocolat noir aux baies foncées, café, mélasse et malt rôti. On perçoit aussi un peu danis, bois et gousse de vanille. Finale chocolatée avec trace de houblons résineux. Texture semi-onctueuse et corps moyen à rond.

Bottle courtesy of Luppolo Station guys in Rome-Italy. Grazie. Black pour, brownish resistant foam. Nose is nice, funky notes, oxidation, caramel, figs. Mouth: carbonation is medium (!), chocolate, Belgian quadruple character.

Aroma is floral, some liquorice, mild alcohol and some toffee. Flavour is fruity, liquorice, toffee and mild lactic notes as well as some mild toast.

Bottle from Js. Pours a deep brown to black with a little bit of foam. Bottle aged for one year. Dark chocolate aroma some treacle notes. Chicory, soy sauce, cardamom on the palate. Roasted coffee. Surprisingly enough, still has a nice hoppy bite on the finish. Expectations exceeded after a trying a year old bottle. Holds up fairly well.
Poured from bottle...deep black pour with creamy head...light lacing...nose is malt licorice and berries...mouth is smooth and dry...solid brew.

Bottle 35,5cl
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, sweet, chocolate, licorice.

Draft sample at Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016. Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 03.07.2016. Pour it dark color with small black head. Aroma dark chocolate, some roasted malt. Taste sweet licorice, vanilla, spice, dark chocolate, maybe not my cup of tea, light to medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation.

12oz bottle. Nose inky with scored and faint soy notes, well not soy, more like MSG, with heavy chocolate and some tar, grain; relatively low on the fruit. More cocoa powder with volume. Pour is very dark brown with a medium-brown head that wobbles. Taste is medium-strong sweet over light-medium bitterness, crisp with hot cocoa powder and dark chocolate, light red berry in the back a very nice accent, earth and faint hops, some high-level alcohol to impress rather than offend. Touch of class with good complexity. Just a touch of meaty smoke, and the airy texture doesnt get out of control. Inky-thick, smooth, dense body near syrup, satisfies. Not my thing for every day, but a great weekender for contemplation. [2016.08.18: 3.9]With volume more glassine crystal malt in the mouth and a ton more plum.  Fruit accumulates, I guess.  Great beer.

On tap at Gollems Proeflokaal. Black colour, beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, roasted malts, liquorice, hint of smoke, hint of leather, quite malty. Flavour is sweet, malty, liquorice, salmiak, dark fruits, some roasted malts, bittersweet finish. Medium bodied. Belgian yeast character is quite prominent. Would really categorize this as a BSA (with a little extra roast).
Bottle from cervezalandia. Dark color. Thin medium brown head. Taste is medium bitter, light sweetness. Aroma is chocolate, roasted, fruity, malt, spices.

Sampled on tap at the Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016, Amsterdam - day#1 (02-Jul-2016).  Clear, reddish black colour with a beige head. Aroma of sweet chocolate malt and coffee. Full body and soft carbonation. Flavour of roasted chocolate malt, coffee, Belgian yeast, spices and herbs. Slightly smoked. Nice and smooth.

Sampled from tap at the Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016. Clear, deep red to black with a beige head. Sweetish, moderately roasty-malty aroma of chocolate, sweet coffee and some licorice. Sweet, slightly roasty-malty taste of caramel, chocolate, sweet coffee and some licorice, followed by a medium long, slightly roasty-bitter, a little yeasty finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Nice!

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2016 Black in color with a short lived tan head. Aroma is roasty and slightly sweet. Flavor follows with earthy notes as well and slight smoke. Sorta awkward for me overall. Wouldnt purchase again.
0,33l fles gedeeld met lion. Zwart met een bescheiden kraag redelijk geroosterd met koffie en cacao en zwarte bessen veel CO2

Tap pour at Of Love and Regret on Baltimore. Deep black in color with tan head. Roasty malt notes with a slight smoke. Taste actually has a bit of dark fruit Belgian to it complementing the traditional smoke and roasted nut notes of a stout. Thin body with an almost black IPA finish. Aftertaste has elements of smoke that linger. Very tasty effort from a brewery that likes to take chances. I think with a slightly toned down smoke quality Ill be even more impressed. In general, Ill spin the yarn of this one for at least the rest of the evening.
Pours dark Carmel with brown lacing. Good carbonation with coffee roasted fruit and a smooth finish. Very nice and easy to drink.
Candy roasted malt, hints of smoke; near black color, tan colorored; sweet, smoky, roasted and caramelized corn, dry finish; medium body, smooth; really, really good.
Draft. Dark brown color. Overly subdued hop flavor. Not much going on with this brew except for the relatively high ABV. Medium bitter finish.

Pours near black, tan head, good lacing. Aroma is chocolate, plums, roasted malt. Taste is the same, some rum, molasses, bitter coffee. Smooth mouthfeel, relatively bitter for the style. Very nice, but doesnt quite come together.

Tap @ Omnipollos Hatt. Black with a creamy beige head, leaving good lacing. Alot of dark chocolate in the aroma with booze and some roasted notes and ash. Silky mouthfeel, mild carbonated. Rich alcohol taste, dark chocolate praline, molasses, sugar and dark dried fruit. The nice yeast and rosted notes is held back by the raw booze.
Dark brown pour with two fingers of foam. Roasty with a little smoke and fruit. Nice balance and complexity.

With Z , a bomber, pours a rich pitch black pour with a Java head. Nose is heavy thick malt, dark black licorice and smoke .Taste is a complex of hops and malt , smoke and black licorice . Finishes on the same tasting notes, with a yeasty malty finish . Quaff Score 7 / 10
Bomber. Pours. Lack with a brown head and aroma of roasted malt. Taste is of roasted malt, with caramel, bread, and biscuit notes with slight dark fruits into the finish.

Heavy fruity roasted malt aroma. Black as night body with a light tan thin head. Sweet dark fruity malt aroma. With a hint of roasted malts. Has a bold character but has a friendly finish. Strong enough to warm the palate on a chilly evening.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Dark brown almost black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, coffee, licorice, caramel, dark dried fruits, some yeasty notes. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Aroma is roasted malt, nutty, a touch of smoke, maybe milk chocolate. Appearance is black, light brown head, but poured thin. Taste is dark fruit, roasted malt, lots of smoke, maybe lactose, decent. Mouthfeel is light, carbonation is pretty harsh, roasted malt aftertaste. Overall, meh.
Draught at All In Beer Fest 2015. Black with beige head. Fruity andchocolatey aroma with some red berries. Medium to full bodied, medium carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness.
Tap @ All In Beer Fest, Gothenburg 151107. Roasted malty and sweet with caramely notes, dried fruits with notes of liquorice, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and roasted.
On tap at All In Beer Fest. Fruity smell with caramel and dark malts. Similar taste, sweet. Well made. The fruity yeast aroma mixes well with the dark malts.
Tap @ All in beer fest 7/11-15. Dried fruity and notes of leather(?). Body is medium, dry finish.

On tap at 40 Brews. It poured a dark color with a tan head. The aroma was of roasted chocolate, prunes and some malts. The taste was of roasted chocolate, orange peel, coffee and some smoke. Good stuff.

På 0,33 l flaske på Lompa,, Oslo. Svart med lysebrunt skum. Vanilje og sjokolade er de første duftene i bildet, røstede rosiner ligger like bak sammen med hint av treverk. Søt og røstet smak med aromabildet bekreftet i munnen. Myk og fyldig.

Bottle. Near black with a quickly dissipating head. Prunes, dark brown sugar, light vanilla, light oak, cloves and light earthiness. Moderately sweet with a complex spice/woody dry finish. Body is heavier with a sticky feel. Very tasty.

Pours pitch black with little head. Aroma: chocolate, coffee, some sweetness like Belgian pralines, vanilla, a touch of lactose. Taste: sweet chocolate, vanilla, a bit of peat, pleasant licorice sweetness and a nutty touch in the palate. At the same time very creamy with alcohol present but in a positive sense. Fantastic, characterful stuff.

Black with a relatively thick but quickly dissipating tan head. Aroma is cocoa with a little bit of alcohol and maybe some dark fruit. Flavor is smooth and roasted with rich cocoa and a body that has similarities to a full bodied red wine.

Interesting stout! Pours black w/ the thinnest of head w/out much lacing. The aroma is sweet w/ just a hint of roast. The flavor is complex w/ a silky smooth mouthfeel. The alcohol is well hidden as the beer is quite drinkable. Im a fan!
Bright black with thin beige head. Aroma of Belgian malts and caramel taste adds chocolate and spices. Sweet, smooth, very low carbonation, "Belgian" finish. Nice.

Keg at the 4th Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Session 3, 02/05/2015. 
Black topped with a decent beige covering.
Nose is Belgian yeast esters, candied fruit peel, light spice, toffee.
Taste comprises dark fruit, cocoa powder, Belgian yeast notes, light charr.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent enough stout.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Dark cola with ruby tints around the edges and a quickly dissipating 1 finger creamy tan head. Aroma is cocoa powder, fig, spearmint and a little roasted malt. Taste follows and adds a little toffee and cherry cordial. Thin mouthfeel and moderate carb. Tasty and complex.
Draft. Pours black. Aroma and taste are roasted malts, chocolate, and some fruits.
Tap @ CBC2015. Clear black with a beige head. Aroma heavy malty (caramel, roasted, notes of chocolate, coffee). Flavor medium+ sweet, medium bitter. Medium to full body, smooth.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark fruit, hint of chocolate and caramel sweetness. Taste of roasted malt, dark fruit, bit of chocolate and coffee with touch of smoke. Has a distinct bitterness and a dry finish. Medium body, smooth with a good malty character with no hint of the 8.4% ABV. Interesting and enjoyable beer.

@red cbc 2015
yeasty spices, brown, dry bitterness, nice smoke, full body, long finish

Draught sample at CBC 2015. Black with a reddish tinge, thin, tanned head. Roasted aroma with licorice, fruits, chocolate, coffee, caramel, earthy hops and dark malts. Taste is bitter. Medium to full body with a creamy texture. Finishes dry and roasted with coffee and gentle smoke. Lovely Stout.

(On tap @ Mikkeller) As grateful as I am at being able to enjoy the leftovers of the CBC I cannot help but reflect on the way I somehow always manage to order dark, strong beers in Mikkeller Bar when I dont have the time to spare to properly warm these beers from the cold temperature at which they are served. Let this serve as a disclaimer to my tasting notes in the below.

Poured into a stemmed Mikkeller glass reveals a pitch black body and the signature Mikkeller pour with no space left over in the glass for proper head formation with a slight ring of surface film. No lace and very weak head regeneration. Aroma is interesting and seems to match my expectations for a foreign stout. Dark but with a funky (not tart) twist that seems to have notes of chocolate, toffee and phenols. Oily texture, medium body, lively carbonation to the point of being prickly on the tongue and aboozy warming finish, which is probably due to the fact that there is very little masking sweetness in the flavour. It never gets unpleasant though. Interesting composition.
Tap @CBC15. Clear black with beige froth. Roasted malt aroma, hints of chocolate. Roasted flavor, coffee and tobacco. Light mouthfeel, dry and bitter.

Pours dark with low latte brown head
Aromas has malty profile, hints of choxolate, asphalt
Taste has light notes of dark malts, coffee, chocolate, dark fruits
Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, berries, chocolate, coffee. Flavour is roasted malt, coffee, yeast, berries, chocolate, yeast, alcohol.

355 ml bottle. Black color with a thin brown head. Aroma of chocolate, raisins, plums, liquorice. Taste is the same. Sweet, with liquorice, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, dark fruits. Medium body with medium carbonation.

Pours black with brown head. Sweet caramel, chocolate aroma. Dry. Smooth, but lacking some complexity

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A pretty great stout. Dark and rich. A ton of fantastic chocolate character. Dark fruit and molasses. Black appearance, deep roasted appearance.

Roasted dark malty aroma and taste, chocolate, some dark fruits, rich and opulent, beautiful.
Bottle, 355 ml from New Beer Distributors, New york. Shared with JFK10000 and Miro. Pours dark brown with tan head. Roasted malts, chocolate, liquorice, bit spicy.

Si presenta di colore nero profondo; poca schiuma color cappuccino e per niente persistente. Al naso è complessa, buona dose di malto tostato, caffè nero amaro e leggermente affumicato, un tocco di lievito e aromi più dolci di frutta scura; che portano alla mente una tipica strong dark ale belga. Il gusto è di malto scuro tostato, leggermente affumicato, odore di caffè; lievito di ispirazione belga, un retrogusto fruttato (datteri, prugne). La bevuta è liscia e rotonda, finale asciutto e moderatamente amaro; lalcool rimane ben nascosto, ma dona comunque una buona sensazione di calore.

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Pours dark brown with a cappuccino foam. Aroma is belgian yeasts, malt ,caramel, brown sugar, some roasted notes, alcohol, powerful. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, a halfway between a belgian strong ale and a stout. High body, medium carbonation. Interesting!

Appearance: pours with a medium tan head, the beer is a dark black color Aroma: coffee, dark roasted malt, cream Taste: sweet, coffee, strong alcohol on the finish, assertive smoke Palate: heavy mouthfeel, strong alcohol aftertaste, lively carbonation Overall: not bad but a bit disappointing, I wish the alcohol was hidden better, could have more flavor ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromat koniakowy, czekolada deserowa, lekka kawa. Barwa brunatna, prawie czarna. Piana drobna, niska. Smak czekolady deserowej i palonych słodów. Niezła goryczka.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, black with no head. Aroma is dark fruits, cocoa, some sweet dark Belgian aromas. Taste is some roast, cocoa, fairly strong ethanol, salty liquorice, light smoke, some earthiness, some dark fruits. Smooth, no carbonation. Not too pleasant.
Tap at Library Alehouse, black pour, tan head, nose is coffee, taste is coffee, vanilla, decent
bottle scura buona schiuma discreta persistenza maltata liece cereale nota speziata pepata tocco erbaceo lieve citrico poco amara
On bottle at Olympen. Pours black with a smallish beige head. Dark fruit, chocolate, raisins nose. Bitter-sweet fruity flavours, some roasted notes. Nice.
Nose is roast, ash, dark, prune, raisin. Flavor is same plus some minerality and a hint of cocoa. steers very clear of any significant sweetness despite the 8.4%. Roast lingers on dry finish.
12oz bottle. Pours black with a nice stiff head of dark tan head. Aroma is dark, rich, smokey, and roasty. Flavors are almost liquor like. Very rich. Good.

Bottle from de Molen beershop, large sample. Dark brown color, big frothy light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, spicy belgian yeast, bit flowery and earthy hop, hint of coffee. Bit dry in taste, bit sweet. There is some chocolatey malt notes, but most of it is washed away by the high amount of carbonation. Thin body, way too high on carbonation. Belgian yeast does too much for me, combined with the belgian amount of carb on it, remains average.

Bottle - Dark sugars, raisin and nice sweet esters. Deep brown black with a gusher light brown lively head. Light brown sugars, dark fruit and a lively body. Nice and dark sweetness, but the lively carbonation takes away a little bit.

Très sombre avec un énorme col marron. Larôme du chocolat et fruits noir avec un très petit peu du café. Cest comme un dubble mais aussi un stout. Le goût est du chocolat et fruit intense avec un peu du café et caramel. Très carbonisé et mais il y a aussi plein de corps.
Medium bodied stout from 12 oz bottle. Slight roast and smoke, and 8.4% is just right. Easy to drink and tasty.

Black colour, beige head. Bit sour aroma, coffee, brown sugar and chocolate. Light sour flavour, quite sweet, roasted malts, bit cheesy. Finish coffee, some sour notes, hint of cheese, brown sugar. (from draught @ CBC blue session, Copenhagen 2014)

12 oz bottle. Bottled on 03/31/14. From saveur-biere.com.
Black colour with a small light tan head. 
Hops, marmalade, sweetness, fruits, molasses, roasted malt and some liquorice in the aroma. 
The flavour is roasted malt, vinous notes, sugary sweetness and mild hints of berries. Strong.
12oz bottle pours a black color with a bit of head. Harsh at first but quickly smoothes out. Mellow flavor, some belgian yeast.

Siamo sempre li...Stillwater..bella etichetta...bel colore...scende giù molto facilmente...una stout che non berrei volentieri tutti i giorni. Forse più gradevole delle sue sorelle ma niente di più. Semplice degustazione.

Sehr dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit einer geringen bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht röstmalzig, Kaffee, reife Früchte, Vanille. Geschmack mild schokoladig, dunkle reife Früchte, Vanille, gering süß.

Bottle at home. Has a black colour with a small, light brown head. Roasted aroma with coffee, chocolate trufles, nougat, coffee and some smoke and licorice. The flavour has more roasted malt, coffee, and ash. Has a silky mouth feel, and a balanced bitterness. A well roasted and balanced stout. Really tasteful.

Pours black with a tan head. Dark fruit, yeast, chocolate, soy sauce, licorice and roasted malt aroma. Chocolate, plum, raisin, licorice, yeast and roasted malt flavors. Full body and modest carbonation. Dark fruit finish.
Aroma is dark malts, mild Belgian yeast and vinous. The flavor is dark fruit/vinous, dark malts, fruit/berries and a mix of sour, acidic and mild smoke in the finish.

355ml bottle from Saveur-Biere. BTLD 03/31/14.


Black stuff with a small beige head. Licorice, smoke, salty. This was better at the beginning but goes too monotonous at the end. Still a good one!

Almost black beer with a medium and beige head. The nose has liquirice, vanilla, sweet strawberries, some chocolate, hint of coffeeish roastiness. Complex and nice aroma. Taste has liquirice, marzipan, some roastiness, nice sweetness, the end is dryer and slightly roasted with vanilla. Medium+ bodied, pleasant and smooth to drink. Could be Imperial stout as well. Complex and slightly personal, enjoyable beer.

Pouah que dire, sûrement une des meilleure bière que jai pu goûter ces 10 dernières années. Elle a du caractère mais reste très équilibrée et son goût de café est bien dosé. La fin de bouche est excellente et on reste sur une touche très agréable. Juste envie den boire une autre. Mon petit plaisir.

0.355l bottle. It has a deep and dark brown pour this one and only a small kinda dark grey / beige head. It has both dark fruit sweetness and roasted tones on the nose. Kinda sweetish at first. Gets darker and more roasted after a while in the glass. Some chocolate and traces of coffee. Dark chocolate biscuits. Smells nice. It has a nice roasted taste with a fair amount of dark berries and candied sugar sweetness. The dark kind. It has a oily feeling in the mouth and its about average on the small prickling bubbles. Definitely not extreme roasted, but it has some darkness. Sweetish with a little alco burn in the aftertaste. Its not anything special going on here, but its a well crafted beer that Id have no problems drinking again. A bit sweet though? Nah, its definitely a nice one this . 08.06.2014

Bottle. Poured black color with an average frothy tan head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate toasted dark malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth dry texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted dark sweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where met.

Color negro ,espuma beige. Aromas de regaliz, azúcar moreno, frutos rojos y café. Cuerpo medio, inicio dulce de regaliz y azúcar moreno, ligero sabor de chocolate y final de amargor moderado y tostado. Muy rica.

Bottle; bomber at home. This one gushed all over the place in the kitchen. EVERYWHERE. This is super-infected; sour lactose and nail vanish. Very rough mouth-feel. Chocolate and booze is there; I think the base beer non-infected would be nice but its just really missing the spot for me. Feel like a twat for reviewing it but I thought the brewery should know that this has happened.
12oz bottle. Pours a dark brown with a thin tan head. Much thinner palate than expected but pretty tasty. The belgian yeast gives it a unique flavor along with notes of coffee and smoke.

December 9, 2014 - bottle from Wine and Cheese. Very dark brown pour with nice amount of head that faded somewhat quickly. Aroma was roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit and some alcohol. Taste was consistent with the aroma, but more of a dark chocolate and coffee mix. Had a nice amount of sweetness that was slightly dry and finished with a hint of alcohol. The body was thinner than I expected, but drank smoothly.

Bottle from Wine Emporium 031214. One of the best stouts that I have had in a long time. Super dark and super tasty. Fills the nose with rich and slightly bitter aromas. Full n the mouth with an aftertaste that goes on and on. A beer to savour.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2015 Muddy black color with cocoa head. Sweet roasty grain nose, with perhaps a touch of hay. This beer does indeed conjure up some essence of the Olde Worlde in the ever so slightly mysterious, yet indescribably familiar bouquet subtext. Perhaps its the infringement of chocolate and anise, and perhaps event a soupcon of molasses. Sweet chocolate body with doses of milk chocolate, anise, and hay. Cacao nibs and roasty, fresh milled roast barley finish. Re-rate 9-7-15: and the experience in much the same--smooth, slightly mysterious, with notes of anise and molasses.

Thick black pour with a dissipating dark brown head. Lots of sticky lacing. Aroma is toasty malt, a little funk, cherries, dark chocolate, and plums. Nice warm presence of alcohol. It's sweet and bracing, with an excellent coffee finish that displays traditional stout flavors. This stout has many elements and really unfolds long after the first sip 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Draught at Beer Temple, Amsterdam, 20 Aug 2014) Black colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of creamy chocolate, coffee and blueberries. Malty, roasted taste with chocolate, coffee, blueberries, cacao and a creamy finish with a generous cacao bitterness. Almost full body, with a certain malt sweetness. Chocolatey, tasty and well balanced. Very nice.
Looks great. This is a decent stout but its just a bit too sweet, both in the aroma and in the body. Quite black, its filling yet sugary.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, berries, chocolate, coffee. Flavour is roasted malt, coffee, yeast, berries, chocolate, yeast, alcohol. Full body. Nice beer.

Pours almost no head on a black body.
The aroma has lots of roasted malt, a little burnt wood, coffee and dark chocolate.
The taste is great. Really roasty with background bittersweet chocolate.
The texture is thicker.
Quite enjoyable.

Black/brown with very fine bubbles, and a thin brown head. Aroma is burnt sugars, with some coffee, and taste is the same, but more along the lines of a dark belgian candi syrup. Very rich and beautiful, , but still finishes clean on the palate. $4/12oz
Pours dark brown/Black with a tan head. Aroma is Roasted malt , dark dried fruits & cocoa. Sweet roasted malt start with dried prunes and some yeast notes and a chocolate finish.

I dont know what makes a Foreign Stout a Foreign Stout, but apparently this Stout is one. Its from Maryland, USA, so I guess its not foreign to Oregon, USA. Anyways, it tastes great, like a Stout should, very rich and a bit sharp around the edges.

12oz bottle. Pours a dark chocolate color with a short, sparkly tan head. Aroma of roasty chocolate, prunes, and slightly boozy finish. Flavors of roasty chocolate, orange peel, and coffee. Smooth and sweet, with a dry and semi-astringent finish.

How: Bottle.
Where: Svenska Hamburgerköket, Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a small beige head.
Aroma: Vinous, dried fruit, caramel.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, malt, some chocolate, dried fruit.
Wonderful overall stout. Amazed its bottled in a 12 oz. Perfectly roasty, perfectly sweet, and so on. Recommended.
Draught at Harrys Hofbrau. Clear brown with brown head. Belgian yeast stars with a subtle funk and moderate chocolate.
12 oz bottle pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Taste is coffee, chocolate, malts and some spice.

[Bottle (12oz)] Pours a very dark brown with an average size semi-lasting frothy light-brown head. Some lacing. Aroma is sweet, yeasty and chocolatey. Flavour of yeast and chocolate along with dark fruit and some sugary sweetness. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium bodied. Just good, a bit too sweet for me.

On tap at The Birch, Norfolk Va. Pours a deep red/black. Cherry, Anise bitter caramel, complex. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355 ml purchase at the Craft Beer Cellar in Waterbury (VT) on August 19, 2014. Pure black, small beige head. Fruity coffee aroma, some spiciness. Fruity chocolate taste, a bit sour, good coffee bitterness. Untraditional but good!

Dark and earthy with a tan laced head from a bottle to glass. Great use of Belgian yeast, as it is apparent in aroma and taste. Solid beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Stillwater Folklore has a thin, beige head, a dark brown (essentially black) appearance, and not really any lacing left behind. The aroma is of sweet, dark-roasted malt, black cherry, dark chocolate, and char. Taste is of dark-roasted, charred malt, black cherry, a touch of licorice, bitterness from the char, prunes, and dark chocolate. Mouthfeel is medium, not heavy, as one might expect. Stillwater Folklore finishes semi-dry, rich, and surprisingly smooth. No real alcohol pick up with this one. RJT
Bottle thanks Jeremy. Black pour with tan head. Licorice, some roasted, chocolate, other almost medicinal aromas. Flavors are roasted and dry malt tones, chocolate, some licorice and spice tones.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 75cl bottle served in a Leffe glass. Absolute gusher! Two minutes and glasses of froth later and I am able to pour this into a glass. Aroma is powerful dark fruits (blackberries, cherries) and burnt malts. Pours a wonderful dark brown (almost black) ale with a hugely impressive dark beige head which persists throughout the drink. This is a sipper. Taste is very complex with the dark fruits promised in the aroma being forefront in its presentation but giving way almost immediately to chocolate and coffee. As the beer warms up charred barrels are very prominent in the aftertaste with a nice tobacco(y) dryness. Mouthfeel is medium so spot on for a stout (this is not an imperial stout) with a reasonably lively carbonation. I have awarded bonus points for the truly excellent artwork on the label. A welcome addition to my repeat order list and further proof that I am preferring American beers to Belgians.
Tap at CBC 2014. Beer in the glass deep black, small head. Starts fine spicy, hoppy background, well balanced. Finish again milder, soft-malty. Malty-dry aftertaste. Okay.

Bottle 355ml, a dark beer with low off white head, nose is on roasted malt with vanilla touch. Aroma is on dry bitter dark chocolate, roasted coffee, dark malt, finish is on the same with nice dark bitter chocolate.

12 oz bottle- Pours black as night with a very small head that reduces to a thin collar. Aroma is typical for a stout, a bit thin actually, some Belgian yeast characteristicts, but pretty basic. The taste is yeasty, chocolate up front, coffee, somewhat Belgian i guess. Body is fairly thin which i was expecting based on what i read on the label, but the carbonation is a bit low which I was not expecting. This is just okay.

Pours black with a large fading head.
Nose shows dry roasted malt, cocoa, milk chocolate and oatmeal.
Flavours include big chocolate notes, dry roasted barley and a hint of liquorice too. A nice amount of residual sweetness.
Carbonation is a bit aggressive.

On tap at the BeerTemple. Dark black brown pour with tan foam. Aroma is roasty, light chocolate notes, light leather, pretty malty. Taste is really roasty, burnt toast, light caramel notes, nice alcohol warmth. Palate is med-full bodied with good carbonation. Easy drinking.

Tap at the Beer Temple, Amsterdam. Poured a deep mahogany with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is malt, yeast, red berry fruit. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a malt light alcohol liqourice bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, red session. 03/05/2014. Brown caramel coloured pour with a halo of off white head head. Aroma s earthy coffee bean, hot alcohol and roast. Flavour is mapel bacon, solvent,caramel and harsh wood. Palate is bitty, dusty on the tongue and semi-dry in the finish.
Draft @ beer temple. Sweetish stout with notes of licorice and some sweet chocolate. Decent.

Coffee, milk chocolate, dried fruits and some roasted malts in the aroma. Almost black with a red tint, tan head. Medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter. Full body with a average carbonation. Overall a nice stout, but i would like a bit less carbonation and a bit less of apple in the flavour.
Svart med lavt lys brunt skum. Lakris, mørke frukter, mørk sjokolade og syrlige bær. Salt, lett bitter og noe søtlige toner i bakgrunnen. Kort men fyldig. Bitter salt avslutning. lite avslutning.

Draught @ BeerTemple, Amsterdam.
Jet black pour, ocre head. Salmiac nose. Flavour too, not much else. Nice, but bit boring.

Very black bodied and with stable beige lace. Coffee, woody, toasted, dark caramel. Rich aroma for the abv. Quite creamy. Taste is creamy too, medium sweet, light smooth hop bitterness thats more apparent in the end. Quite creamy and nice but somehow its not overly appealing to me. Perhaps my mood. (33cl bottle from Bière Révolution)

Bottle from Sonoma Cellars. Pours a very, very dark brown with a light brown head leaving spots of lace. Aroma has dark fruits, caramel, chocolate, and licorice. The plum component of the dark fruits, and contrastingly, the bakers chocolate, come through more down the glass. Taste follows; stone fruits, some chocolate, some caramelly malts. Medium bodied, mostly fruity.  Decent. 14.3

Bottle from Janes Beer Store in Mountain View. Pours black with light brown lacing. Aroma of licorice, spice, and burnt grains. Interesting and unique taste. Floral, spicy notes, with roasty grains, fairly sweet, with a long smooth floral finish. Medium-full body. Pretty nice!

08-AUG-2014, draft @Mikkeller & Friends.
Black with low greyish head.
Aroma is weak roast, sweet licorice and dark berries.
Taste is berries, prunes, roast, coffee but first of all berries.
Above average body and carbonation. Strange one - especially for at stout. Not very roasted. Tastefull and well made but strange.
bottle. black with one finger tan head. strikes me as a quad/stout hybrid. lots of dark fruit, but all the roasty malt that youd expect from a stout. very interesting and tasty brew. well done.
Black with brown tints. Thin head. Chocolate and smoke aromas. Dry roasted flavors and some toffee sweetness makes this a better foreign stout. Finish is not too dry. Very good.
Bottle from Mane Liquor cheers to Baldy. This is a weird one. Kind of seaweedy.... Yeah definitely seaweed as a note in there. Odd stuff. Kind of liked it though. Sessionable as for 8%
Poured deep dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of dark fruit - plums, prunes - dark chocolate, coffee and roast malt. Medium body, flavour as the aroma.

On tap @ Beer Temple, taster size. Black color, beige head. Aromas: red fruit, caramle. Retronasal its sweet, sugarwater, red fruit, some herbs. Flavor is moderate to full sweet, lightly roasted, a bit drop/licorice. Medium bodied. Flavor seems to enhance towards the finish, more roast, light bitterness, but overall to sweet and not very stout-like.
Not the best reaction from kyside after tasting this beer. It had not a clear taste of sweet vinegar if it could exist.
Pitch black, no head. Aroma of chocolate and prunes. Flavor is intense chocolate with notes of dark fruits.
On tap at CBC 2014. Near black with tan head. Very well balanced stout with nice carbonation. Notes of coffee, chocolate, dark fruit, roasted malt and spice.

Flaske fra vinmonopolet vika. Svart ugjennomsiktig farge. Lavt karbonert, noe skum som forsvinner. Smaker mørkbrent malt, sjokolade, kaffe og litt lakris. Hint av Chili helt på tampen av ettersmaken kanskje?. En velbalansert øl.

Draft @ beertemple 
Pours black good , white to grey head 
Smell is oats . 
Taste is bitter , hoppy , perfect carbo . Aromatic . Nice . Some coffee character , as well as chocolate .

5-6 oz draft pour at Of Love & Regret. Black with light tan head, brown hues. Aromas of roast, sweet malt, cream, dark fruit. Tastes of roast, chocolate, spices, Belgian yeast. Medium-full body with a semi-dry finish. Creamy mouthfeel. Medium-low carbonation. Nice.

On tap at Gambrinus in Owensboro KY. Just had a sample. Deep dark pour with a chocolate head. Earthy flavors, very solid stout with a multitude of flavors...coffee, chocolate, a hint of vanilla. Well done

Bottle.
Pours a dark brown near black body with a ring of head. Smells incredible- some smokiness, nuts and chocolate. Pretty rich overall. Sticky palate with lots of roast flavour. Smokiness is again apparent. Very enjoyable.
2014-07-10

Keg at PSBH, Manchester. Black, as expected, with a light brown head. The first thing to jump out is a smoky bacon influence, which is then joined by notes of coffee and molasses. Its all carried through an oily, nearly chewy, mouthfeel which is a great conduit for the flavours. Excellent stout.

Keg @ Port Street Beer House. Pours opaque brown with creamy tan head. Lots of dark fruits and a complex roasted malt taste with a sweet silky mouthfeel and good bitter finish. Very nice and very moreish.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Pours almost jet black with a creamy tanned head. Smell of roasted malts, caramel, some fruity esters, coffee and mocca. Moderate sweet, roasty, dark malts, chocolate and coffee, some milky flavors, fruity tones, dried frutis. Nice complexity, moderate bitter finish with earthy tones and ash. After some sips i find hints of chili and smoke. Very nice

Bottle, 14C. Black with a tan head that fades to a coat quickly but never quite disappears. Earthy aroma with dark berries and grapes, roasted barley, some Coke. Taste is much sweeter than expected and while its not heavy it is insistently mouthfilling. Roasted and earthy flavours, some chocolate, star anise and pepper, some brine, dark berries/ wine. Lowish carbonation about right where I like. Interesting and good.

A nearly opaque black pour with a big tan head that dissipates quickly and leaves good lacing. Aroma is dark fruit forward with figs and plums along with hints of chocolate, coffee and savoriness. Taste has dark fruit and some molasses sweetness. Mid palate there is a grainy roastiness, some dark chocolate, mild coffee and a hint of smoke and earthiness. Finishes with a little sweetness and roasty bitter. Lighter bodied than most stouts with a crisp and higher carbonation also. Big flavorful stout with nicely integrated flavors and mild sweetness that is a compliment to the darker flavors.

A fairly sweet stout. Dark brown/black pour, thin head. Aroma of dark chocolate, anise and roast. Fairly sweet, with chocolate and anise in the forefront. a bit smoky, roasted malt, yeast. Medium body.
On tap at ORiley & Conways, pours black with a thin tan head, aroma is of roast with a good amount of chocolate as well, flavor has a really sweet front end with the finish being the same, ugh

@ Party Town / Florence KY --- Opaque dark brown, thick tan head cover, streaks of lace. Aroma is musty closet and dark malt, somehow appealing. Taste is rich roasted malt with overtones of dark chocolate and coffee. It builds through a solid palate, adding yeast and burnt toast and earth, finally deciding there is enough bitter to balance and letting that linger in a prolonged finish. A really solid stout. Highly recommended.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Cph. Pours deep opaque black with a small, staying, creamy, beige head. Aroma has chocolate, licorice, light roasted, soft nuttiness. Medium, prickly carbonation, great dry and very creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is elegant, soft chocolate, great licorice, soft astringent roastiness. Great balance with good malty bitterness and some salt to finish. Yum!

From a 355ml bottle on 17/6/2014. Pours black with a smallish head. The aroma is a touch odd, with musty basement and earthy notes most prominent, with a bit of chocolate and caramel in the background. In the mouth, and you get dark chocolate, doughy yeast, some soy, and a moderate but lingering roasty bitterness. The carbonation is a touch above medium and the texture is a little creamy. Described on the bottle as an untraditional stout, it certainly is a little different and quite tasty.

Midnight brown, opaque and muddy with no evident carbonation and a thinning, rocky tan head that manages a generous lace. Pasty, chalky, mineral tinged nose showcasing more than enough burnt grain and damp kelp, brine and rust/blood. Similar on the palate. More rust and blood than burnt grain but it is black patent still that dominates this one. Salty kelp, dust, earth and ash fill out the rest. A tangy, tart, estery malt sweetness tickles the side of the tongue whilst there is an astringency to the swallow which melds with it and gives it some depth. Husky, rusty length with little of that alcohol at all to tease. Body is surprisingly light, almost featherweight and it sits lean in the stomach so wouldnt cause a problem in bulk. Carbonation a mere prickle to the front of the tongue, vinous and still from then on south. There is enough here to make it interesting, but its far from complex. I do like the overall result though. A little rough and rustic, and definitely unique. A nice drop! (12fl.Oz, Bottled on 01/02/14, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)
Bottle from Hop City. Pours an opaque black with a thin ring of toffee colored head. Aroma of coffee and dark chocolates. Taste of roasted coffee and almost Coke-like.

Small format bottle. Dark brown with a lasting tan head. Salty and burnt black patent malt nose is woody, fruity-estery and somewhat pepper in a phenolic sense rather than from flavorings. Burnt sugar and oily char favor with a small amount of what could be called "cola" flavoring. Medium body, sweet and seemingly under-carbonated leaving it limp and quick in the mouth, finishing with... man its almost together enough.. the aroma / flavor profile reminds me of Haandbryggeriet Bestefar, which also had a robust wood / spice character entirely derived from malt, hops and yeast (as I understand it). I can say the same about this, I just wish the carbonation were fuller and the sugar fermented out a bit. I went into this without knowing what it was trying to be, and it seems to sit somewhere between robust winter porter and Belgian stout.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 1/2/2014. Pours pitch black color with a 1 finger fairly dense dark tan head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, dark bread, pepper, raisin, plum, fig, light smoke, light licorice, herbal, and roasted/yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt and fruity/earthy yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, coffee, toast, dark bread, pepper, raisin, prune, fig, light licorice, light smoke, herbal, and roast/yeast earthiness. Light roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, coffee, toast, dark bread, pepper, raisin, prune, light smoke, light licorice, and roasted/yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Very nice complexity and robustness of dark/roasted malt and fruity/earthy yeast ester flavors; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy, and lightly chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is a damn nice Belgian stout style. All around good complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roasted malt and fruity/earthy yeast ester flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.
Excellent foreign stout, bodering on Imperial. Rich, smooth decadent with a nice bit on the finish. A tad estry and even a hint of sourness. Thoughtfully constructed.

Pitch black color. Very creamy light head. Very nice espresso, dark chocolate notes with touchs of dark fruit. Nice roasted character, silkly smooth mouth, lots of dark fruit treacles, burnt raisins. Excellent mouth feel. Smooth roasted malt finish. Wonderful.

12 oz. bottle from The Party Source. Pours an opaque midnight brown with an initial finger of tan head that fizzles out immediately into a small ring and small island of film. Aroma of toasted and subtly roasted malts, bakers chocolate, earthy hops, and rubber. Flavor of cola, bakers chocolate, earthy hops, subtle spice, dark fruits, and roots. Medium-bodied, with sharp carbonation and a rich, boozy mouthfeel. Really interesting, unique beer. Not the easiest-drinking foreign stout.

Deep black pour with a thin lacey light tan head. Absolutely wonderful nose with notes of creamy milk chocolate, a kiss of Kahlua, a wisp of smoke, some gentle coffee notes and a earthy bit of nougat. Wonderful flavor full of roast, sweet chocolate, a kiss of smokey coffee, and a little bit of belgian yeast featuring a light kiss of stone fruit and high alcohol esters. If the flavor itself were slightly less boozy this would have been unimpeachable..

Draught at Fermentoren. Low but lasting brown fluffy head. Pitch black body. Sweet roasted malt dried fruit aroma. Creamy and smooth fruity roasted malt cocoa caramel flavor. Little hops bitterness, low carbonation, long sweet finish.

12 oz bottle served in a Belgian snifter. 

Looks like a typical stout, but diverges on all other dimensions. The body is smooth and full, with higher carbonation than usual. The aroma reflects Belgian yeast and spcies more than dark roasted malts. The roasted grains are quite evident in tasting, but this is still spicy and exceptionally complex. Hints of cinnamon and allspice in the lightly sweet flavor 

O: Flavorful, spicy and complex, this is more of a Belgian Stout than a Foreign Stout. Recommended.
12 oz bottle poured into a tulip glass..black with 1 finger tan head..aka of coffee,chocolate,roasted nuts,toffee and smoked peat..tastes just like it smells with smoky undertones..very good.
UPDATED: AUG 30, 2014 On tap @ BBB. Dark amber with a tiny tan head. Fruity and malty tones. Malt, fruit, caramel and hops. Medium to full body with a bitter dry after taste.

Pours a one finger brown head that fades quickly, leaving no lace. Black color, no highlights. Strong carbonation and medium bodied. Light chocolate nose, flavor is roasted-burnt chocolate, some smokiness. $3.79 for a 12oz bottle from Julios Liquors Westborough, MA.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Black color, ok offwhite foam. Roasted aromas, licorice, malt, coffee & choclate: medium aroma intensity. Medium/ full body & high complexity. Some immediate sweetness, followed by solid bitterness- balances well. Very enjoyable

Bottle. Dark brown with a quickly dissipating light brown head. Aroma of dark malts, yeast, fruitcake, alcohol, brandy. Comes across as a rather fruity imperial stout in the taste. Sweet initially, a little tart, liquorice. Roasty aftertaste. Medium body with lively carbonation.

01.06.2014, 0,35l bottle @ home:
Small light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sour-ish roasted, dark malts, roasted grain, sour coffee, hay, burnt caramel, grass, hints of unripe banana. Taste is slightly sour-ish roasted, dark malts, sour coffee, roasted grain, grass, ashtray, burnt caramel, hints of unripe banana and almond essence. Medium bitterness, slightly dry sour-ish mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Pitch black with only a thin off white head.
Smokey and yeasty, yet sweet almost bubble gum aroma, passion fruit and citrus.
Salted caramel and chocolate, burnt toast and cigars, a good dash of citrus and berries. A cherry like sourness and pine resins.
The finish is roasted malt and charcoal bitterness, a good hit of coffee and chocolate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle, consumed on 5-27-14. Labeled as bottled on 01/02/14. Sweet, roasty aroma features scents of brown sugar, caramel, chocolate muffin, other baked goods, and a touch of cigarette tobacco. Quite pleasant smell. Pours a very dark brown with a small amount of taupe head. Opaque liquid. Pleasant taste is consistent with the aroma except with a greater role for the roasted and tarry elements and a lesser role for the sweet elements. Cigarette tobacco and cream flavors. Dry, roasted malt aftertaste (as opposed to a dry, hoppy aftertaste). Medium body. Smooth, oily, and lively in a good palate. Overall, Stillwater Artisinal Folklore is a nice stout. It does not taste as strong as I expected given the relatively high ABV. It is solid and pleasant but nothing special.
Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 2nd Session. Pours black with a beige head, aroma of honey, caramel, chocolate, flavor of honey, caramel, chocolate, dark bread, medium bodied.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2014 750ml bottle. Jet black colour with fulgurous expansionary, average to huge, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, beige to tan head. Chocolately, dark malty aroma of room-filling intensity, hints of its grainy origin, a vinous touch of grapes, chocolate, cocoa, remnants of yeast activity. Taste is yeasty, slightly vinous, slightly grainy, moderately sweet, chocolately dark malty, dark chocolate, husky overtones,; while developing, more and more dry and roasty dark malty notes shine through. Sticky palate, oily texture; too lively carbonation really disturbes the enjoyment of flavours deserving ruminant consumption.

Bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen. Pours an oily black body with a small off-white head. Nose is coffee, Belgian ale yeast tones, banana, leather and hints of chocolate and grains. Taste is banana, chocolate, mild coffee, licorice and hints of grains and leather. Medium body and carbonation. Pretty decent stout from Stillwater.
Bottle. Very dark pour but not too dense looking. Foamy cream head. Roasty and a little yeasty. Pretty straightforward beer and pretty good.
750ml bottle from beers of Europe. Colour is very dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is chocolate, pepper, and molasses. Taste is the same.

Bottle. Dark black pour with nice tan ring. Coffee, vanilla, Belgian yeast, smoke and booze. The taste has a smoked malt front but relaxes into a more bittersweet chocolate taste. Dark fruits, raisins. Harsh herbal finish. Interesting stuff. ABV not really hidden here. Good name and label are a plus too.
Black no foam. Aroma is super non-descript - mild malt tang. Taste is very smooth but not overly interesting. Nil complexity. Best thing about this guy is the ABV is very well hidden. Boring.

Pours a dark dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is moderate roast and a heavy does of belgian yeast. Works pretty well. Taste is dominated by roasted malts but with a fruity touch from the belgian yeast. It is rather dry with a bitter finish that is quite parching actually. The body seems somewhat light considering its above average abv. but with close to a fizzy palate it also works pretty well.
Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma of malt. Taste is sweet chocolate, yeasty, Belgium flare. Just ok.
Tap @ CBC14-red. Black. Roasty nose with some coffee. Lightish body, but with a nice yeastyness. Dark fruity, ok.

Draught @ CBC 2014. Pours black with a small creamy tan head, lacings. Aroma of malt, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel. Flavor is malts, caramel, coffee, dark chocolate hops, hint of smoke. Medium body, soft carbonation, light warming alcohol in the finish. 030514
Draft - really cold. Nose is coffee. Sip adds coffee roast. Dry and smoky. Not fruity as I have come to expect from the style. Well hidden ABV. Boozier as it warms and loses dryness. Decent.

[5/2/14] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. 2nd session. Black with a brown head. Aroma of roast, dark fruits, a bit of coffee and a licorice touch. Sweetish flavor with dark fruits, licorice and some roast. Medium to full-bodied.
Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Pitch black. Liquorice and smoek aroma. Lots of smoke flavour, too. Very enjoyable. Smooth.

Bottle. Pours a near black color with no head on it. Nose is very roasty, with some sour fruit elements to it, and a slight bit of smoke to it. Taste is a little sour and definitely roasty, with a sharp and bitter bite to it. Its an odd drink, but interesting...

Sampled at esbls. Black with a tan head. Somehow this smells like a north west European stout. Fruit. An interesting flavor. Molasses, brown sugar, a little harshness and alcohol. Background hops are citrus.

Sample at CBC 2014. 

Dark brown with a small head. Aroma and taste ot roasted malt, yeast, some berries, wood, choclate and caramel. The body was medium and the finish dry.

Sampled @ CBC 2014. Opaque, pitch black color, beige to light brown head. Smell and taste malts, dark malts,, a bit peppery, bitter, slightly liquorice, lightly ashy and earthy. Medium body and carbonation.
Bottle at The Bier Stein, Eugene. Pours a dark brown/red, little to no tan head. Aroma yeast forward, tang, molasses. Body full, rich, finish spicy. Yikes! Fucking huge.
Sample @ CBC. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malts, spicy belgian yeast. Taste is sweet malty, chocolate, spicy finish. Medium body.

CBC 2014. Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla, dark red berries. Taste is roasted malts, vanilla, chocolate, slight tartness, dark red berries. Mouthfeel is quite dry with a medium body. Aftertaste is chocolate, honey, brown sugar.

Tap @CBC2014
Dark opaque brown color, small steady beige head. Licorice and some kind of alcohol in the nose. Medium-bodied. Caramel, licorice, some grassy hoppyness almost turning to vegetables. Light notes of alcohol. Interesting.

Draught @ CBC2014, Copenhagen. Pours a dark brown colour with a small head. Aroma of toasted malts, biscuit, some grains and raisins. Flavour of raisins, wooden tartness, caramel, some grains and bread. Medium bodied and a dry, malty, sweet finish. Enjoyable

Tap @ CBC14.
Pours black color with a small head. Aroma of spices, dark malts and earth, some yeasty notes also. Flavor of chocolate, yeast, some dark fruits and spices. A very common belgian stout.
3424

Pours dark brown with a smooth head. Aroma of smoke, roastiness, ash, earthiness, yeast and dark chocolate. Taste is sweet, roasty and ashy with earthy notes, dark chocolate and smoke. Finish is sweet, roasty and a bit stuffy with some cocoa and dark chocolate. A bit unbalanced.

Draught @ CBC14
Aroma is a bit odd with urinal and roasted tones. Also some berries. Flavour has cocoa, malty tones, cocoa and chocolate. Also some sugary tones. Feels like a dobbelbock. And a good one. Also some industrial, metallic tone occurs a the end of the glass.

Medium dark brown head. Opaque black body. Roasty earthy
licorice aroma with banana and soy sauce notes. Sweet, and

Tap at the Copenhagen beer... Deep black... Thin tan lacing... Dark berry chocolate malts nose... Soft sweet roast malts... Light roast

Bottle from Whole Foods Westlake, Seattle; bottled 10/08/13Black color with medium sized brown head, not persistent. Aroma of roasted malt and breadcrust, with an impression of soap and cheese. The mouthfeel is lean, and quite smooth; the flavor is quite roasty, but not too ashy, with a touch of dark chocolate and liquorice, very light anise and chili peppers, a bit salty; the residual sugars are quite low, the bitterness reasonably high. Mild astringency in the final. Balanced overall.Good beer, nothing more. An Imperial Stout like many others.

Sample @ CBC 14. Pours a very dark, clear brownish beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma of sugar cane, dark chocolate and roasted malts. Flavor is medium sweet, loads of roasted malts, chocolate. Sticky mouthfeel. Long sweet finish. Very decent.

Tap at Watering Hole. On the heavy side, quite thick, lots of dark fruit. Almost porter like. Liquorice, lightly spicy, fruity, soy sauce, light smoke. Initial sweetness, but then fairly dry finish. Bit of cola about it. Pretty nice.

Draft at Of Love & Regret. Pours very dark brown with a fizzy tan head. Tastes like bitter coffee, raisins, booze, light syrup. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet booze, raisin, cherry.

Mild fresh-squeezed darks fruit aroma, prune juice, some yeast. Medium dark brown, flat. Light melange of raisins, prunes, and dates. Light chocolate roast emerges in mid palate. Decided alcohol warmth. Medium body and just a little spritzy. Fun on the tongue. A nice take on the Belgian stout.

On tap at the Stillwater at Dig Bar. Foreign Stout. One of their rare dark beers, its brewed with the Rochefort yeast strain. It pours a dark brown with a rusty beige head. The aroma is plum, roasty chocolate with a bunch of umami meatiness. The mouthfeel is quite nice, silky smooth & full bodied. The taste is sharp, fruity, dark roasty, pitted fruits - cherry-like.
Dark brown, almost black body w/ a tan head. Chocolate, dark fruit and coffee aromas. Bittersweet chocolate boozy flavors.

Bottle from BOTW. Brought this back for my mates, but they will all get it on tap next week, as will I, so I drank it. very fruity nose, grapes and cherries, light citrus. Maybe some chocolate, coffee, and licorice, but its light. Dull black with lace. Flavor is more stout-like; lots of dark chocolate, some coffee, roasted wood, fruits. Nice and interesting. Not a straight-forward stout, something spicy and Belgian. Good stuff, though. Body it a bit thin, but i dig it.

(Bottled 1/2/14) - 1 Finger orangy brown head of fine bubbles. Dark black body. Slight smokey aroma. Dark malts carry over into the flavor. Burnt malt on the back end. Some mouth feel, though seems proper for the style and alcohol content. Says unfiltered. But there was no sludge on the bottom of the bottle after pouring. Nice sipping stout.

Bottle at Union Square Cafe NYC. Superb bottle label. Dark black colour, decent carbonation, off white head. Never really understood Belgian stouts before, they always seemed quite stouty and not so Belgian, but I think Im slowly getting there. This one had clearly a good roasty malt profile, but then a spiciness and slightly herbal note which was very interesting. I was a fan, and this beer did extraordinary things in conjunction with the fennel shortbread which came with one of the desserts in this place. It was a taste sensation.

Bottle pour. Very dark with medium head. Aroma is multi-dimensional with some coffee and some sour fruit. Malty flavor with a quick change to chocolate, coffee, caramel, and dark fruit. Very roasted flavor to finish. I really enjoy this beer. Very complex. Delicious.
Draft. Fairly hoppy and roasty. Not even sure what they were going for but is pretty nice.

Deep dark brown coloured body, about 95% opaque with a thin, oily brown head. Aroma of deep roasted malt, earth, oatmeal, anise and a touch of caramel - strong. Medium to Slightly-Full-Bodied; Strong dry earthy flavour at first with a lot of oatmeal and roasted malt, some light cacao, a moderate amount of yeast notes and some light tastes of oysters. Aftertaste is slightly sweeter with caramel and toffee, but the very dry assertively bitter flavour doesnt sit too well. Overall, a fairly one dimensional and rather uninspiring beer with not enough profile or complexity to be a good beer in any of the stout categories. This tastes more like a dry stout than anything else, but even that category wouldnt make this beer good. Im guessing the high ratings are from the label on the front. Take that off or replace it and youd lose the lustre of this beer. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle after a hockey game in Arlington, Virignia on 19-March-2014 - Thanks Kevin!

from Mikkeller & Friends - pretty black beer under a persistent beige foam; bready with some roasted malts, a bit mineral with notes of black chocolate; full-bodied, velvety mouthfeel, earthy and pretty sweet, light bitterness and some residual sweetness in a long coffeish, earthy and nutty finish - interesting profile

This pleasant surprise is very dark brown, almost black, with red hues. It has a dark, malty aroma, while not being too roasted. Its nice and easy. The flavor is really nice, almost fruity, and nearly candy-like, but not in the way that most fruity stouts are. Its really nice and inviting, a real treat. It has a soft, beautiful mouthfeel and finish, nearly chocolaty, thin, but complex and mature. Bueno.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2014 [5266-20130426] Tap. Roasted malt grain and light coffee-infused aroma. Black body with a huge long-lasting creamy light brown head. Spiced boozy yeast bread flavour has a Belgian cucumber-y base. Medium-full body. Very odd at first, I thought the Belgian yeastiness was jalapenos. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4

[5324B-20130430] 1pt9.4floz bottle. Roasted woody grain yeast aroma. Black body with a long-lasting creamy tan head. Roasted Belgian yeast and boozy grains flavour. Full body. Very tasty, quite big. (8/4/8/4/16) 4.0
(@ Liquids & Solids, Lake Placid, NY)

A tremendous, lasting, dense tan head covers the almost black pour. Highly yeasty nose procures spicy phénols which veer toward medicine amidst flowery, fruity esters in a rather alcoholic surrounding from a sub 9% ale. Underneath it all, talkative roasted grain pairs with a smoky, eucalyptus, earthy bottom to ensure somber thought developments. In mouth, the intensely biting carbonation surprises. You are clearly in a Belgian context aromatically speaking and texture Wise, but the spiciness, alcohol, roast and smoke seem less interested in working together and more interested in picking fights. Im not feeling a great deal of balance here whereas Im usually fond of Stillwater offerings, and of dry beers and that one surely is.

12 ounce bottle - black pour with a fairly thick tan lace - nose of charred, bitter maltiness, raisin, dried cherries, smoke - there is also a moderate fusel alcohol presence reminiscent of model airplane glue which is pretty off-putting, which is a shame because the other notes are nice - medium body, with a lightly oily, mouth-coating texture - flavor lacks some depth - some bittersweet chocolate, anise, a touch of smoke, light tart cherry acidity on the tail end - there is a sharp mineral note near the end - finish is a bit high on the retro-nasal alcohol presence, but at least the flavor is mostly devoid fusel alcohol flavor - certainly one of the weakest offerings from this brewery - I wonder if the 750s produced at another facility are like this.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a thick tan head. 
Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, earth, coffee and had notes of smoke. Flavor of dark chocolate, black coffee, smoke, molasses, earth, dark fruit and had a dry finish.

12oz bottle poured into a tulip - dark brown with a tan head that quickly disappears with no return. Aroma is belgian yeast with hints of dates and sugar. Flavor is the same with coffee and mineral notes but completely flat half way through drinking it. I didnt enjoy this.

pours clear dark brown with a small yet reviving beige-orange head, some retention and lacing. burnt malts, roastiness-plenty, ashes, cacao, slightly milky and dusty, belgian profile - yeast, dark fruitiness, hint of bubblegum, molasses and dark candi; very boozy but also quite smoky and earthy. average to moderate carbonation, light to medium body - oily, dry bitter coffee-mineral-piney harsh finish. o-k.

Taster on draft, very dark pour, coffee and malt ... Very smooth. Excellent!

BOD 10/8/13. Dark, almost black pour, with a weak head that dissipates quickly with almost no lacing. Nose is of Belgian yeast phenolic esters over a light background of chocolate, plum, prune and licorice. Medium body with a nice smooth, almost slick, mouthfeel. Low carbonation level. The complex flavor profile contains those present in the nose. Unfortunately, the phenols predominate and mask what could have been a nice complex ale. The finish is smooth and a phenolic aftertaste lingers. Had this been fresh, I would have scored it lower. Due to its age, I gave it the benefit of the doubt.
Bottle. This is a really nice little stout with lots of dark chocolate flavours and smokey dark fruits.

Flaske, 75 cl. Dyb rød-brun, der starter som en gusher, men snart står tilbage helt uden skum. Dufter af belgisk gær, karamel, ristet malt og hvedebrød. Sødlig lakridset smag. Fennikel. Anis. Mad-øl til gryderetter - med god bitterhed til at skylle fedtet ud af mundhulen.

draft poured a dark deep red color with a small whitish head. the initial aroma or Belgian yeast and alcohol and dark fruits. the flavor was more of the same but intense in the dark red fruits possibly plums. very rich malt sweetness and the Belgian yeast. a very good representation of the style.

10/7/13 bottle (brewed at Two Roads), drunk on 1/21/14Deep chestnut brown body has auburn tints on the edges, with a charred-beige colored head that very quickly recedes to a light smattering around the edges. High clarity, with no sediment left behind.Prunes, raisins, roasted barley, vanilla, hickory and Belgian esters (bubblegum, light banana and vanilla) in the nose definitely seem pretty spot on for a Belgian stout. Some glue-like fusels are faintly noted at first. Medium strength of aroma with the esters and alcohol drowning out the maltiness.Milk chocolate and roasted barley flavors lead things off, with some dry, astringent notes from the barley and lots of alcohol fusels. A bitter, perfumey alcohol note is felt in the back of the throat and lingers on the finish, while the maltiness, sweet at first, dosent seem to have much depth and succumbs to the heavy esters/fusels. Glue, cherries and prunes all linger on the finish, and the beer remains very dry with some tobacco and dark chocolate notes. Theres some good stuff goin on here, but its pretty scattered about and this pervasive alchol and heavy ester profile makes it quite difficult to drink. Maybe they let the fermentation temps go a little bit too high on this one? I dont know, but its definitely problematic for the beer. The bottles have sat warm at Julios (where I bought them) but the other three Ive had so far (IBU, Existent and Cellar Door) exhibited none of this, so its hard to imagine thats the problem. Will certainly try again.

Bottle. Aroma is chocolate, pepper, smoke, and molasses. Appearance is very dark brown with a thin tan head. Taste is chocolate, smoke, pepper, Belgian yeast, and a slight touch of earth. Medium full body and light carbonation. Overall a good Belgian stout with subtle layers.

750ml bottle, with a black dark brown color, with an average bubble tan head, but falls quickly. Mild yeasty, chocolate chip cookie dough, cocoa, mocha, chocolate milkshake, brown chocolate nose, with some light dark dried fruit, faint licorice, burnt toast notes, with some roasted, black, chocolate, toasted malt, dark bitter chocolate, coffee accents in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth yeasty, dark dried fruit, dark bitter chocolate, roasted grind coffee bean, black coffee, burnt toast, mild chocolate chip cookie dough character, with some roasted, black, chocolate, toasted malty, molasses, licorice, burnt chocolate pie crust, cocoa, boozy chocolate liquor flavours, leading towards a warming, belgian yeast fruitiness, dark bitter chocolate, black coffee, chocolate, black, toasted maltiness, lingering roasty bitterness finish.

A large bang when I open the bottle and the beer found its own way out. Pours a almost pitch black colour with a huge soapy brown head. Aroma of smoke, leaves, som coffee and light touches of chocolate. Pleasant smell. Flavour is smokey, earthy, leaves, espresso and hints of alcohol. A lot of carbonation from the belgian yeast, which create a rather sticky mouthfeel. Overall, a very good beer, but maybe a bit too much carbonated for me

12 oz bottle. Pours a dark brown with a one-finger chocolate colored tan head with a good amount of lacing that slowly slides back into the beer. Aroma of Sweet Tart candy, (I assume a combination of the Belgian yeast and candi sugar), dominates the nose. Also picking up black licorice, dark fruits (plum and raisin mostly), dark chocolate, slight bit of coffee. Taste is roasted chocolate and caramel malts up front with candi sugar, dark fruits, black licorice, a bit of dark chocolate and a bit of alcohol. Medium body, slick but slightly oily texture, average carbonation, long dry and bitter finish in which the hops come though with the candi sugar. An interesting beer. The Belgian yeast brings out a distinct flavor that helps it stand out from other stouts. Tasty and original!

Bottle. Opaque black with short lasting khaki head. Earthy and boozy aroma with champagne like notes as well. Medium body, lively mouthfeel. Warming alchol in finish. Bitter dark chocolate aftertaste. Dry finish with some dark fruity notes.

Bottle at the 14th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering on 03/19/2011 courtesy of BeerandBlues2 as 25 to One - A Stillwater / Maxs Taphouse Anniversary. Dark black body with a small creamy tan head. Sweet roast, chocolate and caramel aroma. Dry roast, chocolate and faint fruit flavor. Medium full body with moderate carbonation.

Pours dark brown with an off white ring. Little to no lacing. The aroma is a malty dark fruit grain smell with maybe some alcohol. The taste is likened unto an imperial stout with sweetness coming through strong in the end. Its slightly over carbonated but still good. The taste of alcohol came through a little strong at first but calmed down.

Tap at Alehouse. Pours deep blank with a coffee icecream colored head that lingers. Scent is multigrain bread, dark chocolate, coffee. Flavor follows nose. A earthy coffee bitterness and a touch of warmth on the finish.
Very dark brown pour, medium brown head. Chocolate, light smoke, roasted malt, molasses, plums. Creamy and pretty good brew.

Dunkel malziger und fruchtiger Antrunk mit deutlich zu viel CO2. Ansonsten frisch, die Malzigkeit gefällt, milde Kaffeenoten, die Fruchtnoten bleiben vorhanden, hefig. Süßlich malziger, geringfügig röstiger Abgang. 10/9/10/11/10/11
Colour is almost black with small slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, hints of coffee, fruits and malts. Quite fruity for a stout.

Krampusnacht special. Dark black pour with nice khaki ring. Coffee, vanilla, Belgian yeast, smoke, booze. The taste has a smoked malt front but relaxes into a more bittersweet chocolate taste. Dark fruits, raisins. Harshish herbal finish. Interesting stuff. Awesome name and label are a plus too.

12oz bottle. Bottled on 10/8/13. Poured cool, not cold and let come up in temperature. Pleasant aromas of dried dark fruit, vanilla extract, spice, and nutty roasted malt, with hints of chocolate and mild coffee. Very nice, elegant aromas. Fine, tingly, medium-plus carbonation, medium body and a dry, mouthwatering finish that sets it apart from other sweet domestic stouts. Distinct overtones of chocolate, roasted coffee beans, cinnamon spice and ash, with subtle undertones of dark, dried fruit (prunes, raisins). Overall, another solid offering from Stillwater. A good Belgian Stout? ..that is a step more American, then Belgian. IMO a lighter, drier, mouthwatering, Speedway Stout. Good stuff. I want more!

750mL bottle. Pours black with a huge brown head. Over carbonated. It gushed when the bottle was opened and when poured ¾ of the glass was head. Roasted malt, earth notes, dry finish, slightly tart.

12 oz bottle. Pour is black. Lively head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, earthy, and hints of smoke and phenolic spice. Flavor is more of the same. Flavorful but not overly intense. Body is on the lighter side but very drinkable. Smooth finish.

2/8/2013. From bottle. Pours mahogany with a beige head. Aromas of dark roasted malt, dried fruit, Belgian yeast, chocolate and spices. A hint of smoke. Balanced and complex with dark fruit and spice flavors.

This rich brownish black beer has a very strong coffee aroma and flavor. When we poured it it was like 95% head. We waited and let it settle. It was better in the second pour.

On tap at Of Love and Regret in Baltimore. Wow. Really nice. Fantastic beer. Lots of chocolate and roast. Pours dark brown with a creamy off white head. Very sweet. Medium bodied.

On tap at Beermongers. Colour....basic black with a thick off white head. Nose...quite Belgian-y! Theres also orchard fruits and yeasty bits. Palate...tangy and again, Belgian-y! Rather sweet with chicory, Lindt sweet dark chocolate, fig paste and dark raisins, plums and anise. Certainly a stout and certainly....well...,Belgian-y!

12oz bottle, from Party Source. Bottled 10/08/13. Shared with Taylor. Clear very dark brown / red color, near-black. Minimal off-white head, dots of lace. Medium to bigger body. Lightly slick body. Lighter, crisp carbonation. Nose has a surprising amount of dark fruit, light spice. From the smell its kind of like a foreign stout, or belgian style stout... But the taste is surprisingly tart. Duh, should have expected Stillwater to pull something like this. Tart taste, light sour, kind of spicy. Moderate bitter, some dark chocolate. Not too chewy of a texture, a little thin. Solid, interesting stout. Fruity and tart, but still nice, roasty, and robust. Interesting, yeah, but right now I think Id have preferred a more traditional, full-bodied stout. Hint of licorice.. As far as sour stouts go, this one might be missing something
Pours really dark but is really lacking aroma. Slightly sour but has a really nice stout taste. Very good!

Bottled. 

Black pour with a fine tan head. Fair lacing. 

Nose is roasty, smoky, and a little tart. 

Medium-full mouthfeel. 

Roasty malt. Coffee, cocoa, Belgiany yeast. A little tang to the finish. Some smoky notes. 

Deliciously different.

Opaque, nearly black pour. Vanishing mocha head. Aroma of smoky Belgian yeast. A more complex flavor than anticipated based on the nose. Roasted, charred, a little bitter. Some dark fruit notes with buried caramel undertones. Pretty well balanced. Slick and flat with a long, dry finish. Lingering alcohol. Pretty solid Stillwater offering.

This is a very interesting, fairly complex brew from Stillwater. The pour is black in color with a thick tan head. A firm layer sticks for some lacing. My first impression is that theres a lot going on based on the aroma. Bakers chocolate is followed by raisin bread, ash, leather, and an earthy character. The flavor seems centered around dark fruit, mocha, and charred malty notes. A bit smokey throughout. Molasses, dates, yeast, and earth adds plenty of depth. The carbonation is very active. Theres some alcohol creeping in there but its not hard to drink. The body doesnt seem all that thick or full, but not thin. I dont see this style as Stillwaters best (give me their Saison stuff) but its a good and very interesting beer.

Láhev 750 ml. Aroma má krásný nádech lutého melounu a karamelu. Pěna je vysoká, moccacino barvy, jemná a pomalu mizící. Barva samotného piva je temná a neprůsvitná. UPDATED: OCT 30, 2013 This bottle, from Malt and Vine, foams slowly upon opening and continues foaming slowly out of the bottle for an hour or so. The beer pours deep black with a meringue head that you could cut with knife and fork. plenty of lacing down the side of the glass. Roasty nose struggling with sour grassy aromas. Flavor is pretty sweet-and-sour, plenty of molasses bread, very Stillwater yeast, wisps of smoke in the tail. Earthy. Baking chocolate. Hints of black cherry. Interesting, and very complex compared to the Dragonstooth stout I have open at the same time - but it doesnt come together into harmony.
UPDATED: JUL 18, 2016 to me this seems like an imperial brown but call it what you will it is rife with caramel. still dark brown if you will there is a hint of butterscotch and more.

Bottle. Heavy malt notes of toasted dark bread and dark chocolate, light resin for the hops, moderate dough for the yeast, with charcoal, vanilla and tobacco. Head is average to large, frothy turning creamy, light brown with thick but slippery lacing and is fully lasting. Color is very dark brown. Flavor starts moderately sweet and acidic, and finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly acidic. Palate is fuller side of medium, creamy with a lively carbonation and a moderately alcoholic finish. No matter what kind of Stout this is, it is absolutely one of the best around.
Draft sampled at Rattle n Hum, NYC. Pours near black with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, roast, coffee and malt. Flavour is over mordant sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle (gusher). Molasses malt and hay aroma. Dark brown with giant head. Sweet molasses/prune malt and bitter herbal hay flavor. Dusty finish. Excellent.

(bottle - 22 oz) Dark brown pour with a thick tan head and ruby highlights. Very rich and roasted malt and chocolate aroma. Roasted chocolate and malt aroma at the start with some dark fruits and rich chocolate at the finish. Bitter coffee-like finish and some mild spice. Smoke comes through a bit at the finish. Nicely blended.

22 ounce bottle .. . Pours a hazy dark amber .. . Lots of foam .. . Yeast, dirty hay, and bored head .. . Mild mouth .. . Goes in so many directions, but none with a map .. Pass on this .. . . You are a buffoon. Now cut my beard!

Bomber. Pours near black with a chocolate brown head; foamy and lasting. Aroma roasted malt, caramel, fruit, yeast and coffee. Flavor is sweet caramel, fruit, chocolate, semi-bitter roasted malts and coffee with underlying yeast notes. Medium bodied.

One hell of a great label. Although it looks like it says "art is anal." Just pointing that out. Pours an opaque brown with the enormous, fill-the-glass bottle-conditioned head.
